thread.title: The Teachers Need Shooter Drills, Not Their Students

author: wsjcom
title: The Teachers Need Shooter Drills, Not Their Students
text:
Regarding former FBI agent John G. Iannarelli’s “Schools Need Active-Shooter Drills” (op-ed, Feb. 16): Mr. Iannerelli has it backward. It is the teachers and staff that should have active-shooter drills, not the children. Schools should control entry and make better security arrangements that everyone understands. Another idea to be considered is banning rifles like the AK-15 that have the capacity to rapidly fire a large number of bullets in a short period from large magazines that can be quickly replaced. The last thing we should do is take the child out of childhood, especially for such an unlikely event.
